Rats are small animals that can be found in numerous locations, mostly in cities, sewers and dungeons. Thus, they are common animals found throughout RuneScape, typically Combat level 1 or 3.

Although most rats have no drops, the level 1 rats in the Stronghold of Security have a 100% chance to drop bones.

Rat idle animation.

Considered by most players to be the weakest monster in the game, rats are frequently used to train Magic with Splashing. Rats possess only 2 Hitpoints, 8 total experience, 0 Defence, a max hit of 0, and Attack accuracy of 1. Rats are quite literally half as strong as chickens.

Rats respawn after a single game tick, the fastest respawn rate in the game. Rats appear in many dungeons and sewers throughout Gielinor, and due to their weakness and commonness, rats are not marked on the minimap. A similar critter, the level 1 spider, shares the same stats as the rat.

When clue scrolls were first introduced, rats had an extremely low chance of dropping an easy clue scroll. This was later changed so that rats never drop clue scrolls.

The rat was one of the first entities ever added to RuneScape, being the fifth behind Hans, goblins, men, and women. Its larger counterpart, the giant rat, soon followed.

Contents

  • 1 Cats
  • 2 Locations
  • 3 Drops
    • 3.1 100%
    • 3.2 Tertiary
  • 4 Trivia
  • 5 Changes
    • 5.1 Gallery (historical)

Cats[edit | edit source]

Rats can be chased by cats. When telling a cat to chase vermin, it will pounce at a rat in range, attempting to catch it. If your cat successfully catches at least 100 rats, you can talk to Gertrude to get a Cat training medal, which has no special uses other than being a collectible. Furthermore, if you have a rat pole, up to six caught rats can be added to it as decoration.

Each type of cat has a different catch rate:

  • Kitten - 10%
  • Normal - 50%
  • Overgrown - 0% (cannot chase rats)
  • Wily - 70%
  • Lazy - 41%

Hellcats share the same catch rates as regular cats, depending on their type.

Drops[edit | edit source]

The following drop rates are provided by Jagex, unless otherwise specified.

100%[edit | edit source]

Item Quantity Rarity Price High Alch
Bones1Always[d 1]700
  1. ↑ Bones are only dropped in the Stronghold of Security.

Tertiary[edit | edit source]

Item Quantity Rarity Price High Alch
Rat's tail1Always[d 1]Not sold1
Rat bone(m)11/4[d 2]Not soldN/A
Looting bag(m)11/15[d 3]Not soldN/A
  1. ↑ Rat's tails is only dropped during Witch's Potion.
  2. ↑ Rat bones are only dropped during Rag and Bone Man II, and not by the rats in the Stronghold of Security.
  3. ↑ Looting bags are only dropped by those found in the Wilderness.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The regular and Stronghold of Security rat variants had festive overrides wearing red partyhats during the 2017, 2018, and 2019 Christmas events.
  • In RuneScape: The Official Handbook from 2006, it is stated that regular rats may weigh up to 70 pounds. This is likely an error in unit translation, as other weight and height statistics in the handbook are unrealistic - such as Guard Bandits weighing "up to 70lbs" and Giant Spiders having their height listed as 30 feet.

'''Rats''' are small animals that can be found in numerous locations, mostly in cities, [[sewer]]s and [[dungeon]]s. Thus, they are common animals found throughout ''[[RuneScape]]'', typically [[Combat level]] 1 or 3.

Although most rats have no drops, the level 1 rats in the [[Stronghold of Security]] have a 100% chance to drop [[bones]].

[[File:Rat idle animation.gif|thumb|right|Rat idle animation.]]
Considered by most players to be the weakest [[monster]] in the game, rats are frequently used to train [[Magic]] with [[Splashing]]. Rats possess only 2 [[Hitpoints]], 8 total [[experience]], 0 [[Defence]], a max hit of 0, and [[Attack]] accuracy of 1. Rats are quite literally half as strong as [[chickens]]. 

Rats [[respawn]] after a single game tick, the fastest respawn rate in the game. Rats appear in many dungeons and sewers throughout [[Gielinor]], and due to their weakness and commonness, rats are not marked on the [[minimap]]. A similar critter, the level 1 [[spider]], shares the same stats as the rat.

When [[clue scroll]]s were first introduced, rats had an extremely low chance of dropping an [[Clue scroll (easy)|easy clue scroll]]. This was later changed so that rats never drop clue scrolls.

The rat was one of the first entities ever added to ''RuneScape'', being the fifth behind [[Hans]], [[goblin]]s, [[men]], and [[women]]. Its larger counterpart, the giant rat, soon followed.

==Cats==
Rats can be chased by [[Cat|cats]]. When telling a cat to ''chase vermin'', it will pounce at a rat in range, attempting to catch it. If your cat successfully catches at least 100 rats, you can talk to [[Gertrude]] to get a [[Cat training medal]], which has no special uses other than being a collectible. Furthermore, if you have a [[rat pole]], up to six caught rats can be added to it as decoration.

Each type of cat has a different catch rate:

*[[Kitten]] - 10%
*[[Cat|Normal]] - 50%
*[[Overgrown cat|Overgrown]] - 0% (cannot chase rats)
*[[Wily cat|Wily]] - 70%
*[[Lazy cat|Lazy]] - 41%

[[Hellcat|Hellcats]] share the same catch rates as regular cats, depending on their type.

==Trivia==
*The regular and Stronghold of Security rat variants had festive overrides wearing [[red partyhat]]s during the [[2017 Christmas event/Gallery|2017]], [[2018 Christmas event/Gallery|2018]], and [[2019 Christmas event/Gallery|2019]] Christmas events.
*In [[RuneScape- The Official Handbook|''RuneScape: The Official Handbook'']] from 2006, it is stated that regular rats may weigh up to 70 pounds. This is likely an error in unit translation, as other weight and height statistics in the handbook are unrealistic - such as [[Guard Bandit|Guard Bandits]] weighing "up to 70lbs" and [[Giant Spider|Giant Spiders]] having their height listed as 30 feet.
